sen.j: 三宅 秀（みやけ ひいず、嘉永元年（1848年）11月 - 昭和13年（1938年）3月16日）は、日本の医師・蘭学者・医学者・国会議員（貴族院 (日本)）。
sen.e: Hiizu MIYAKE (November - March 16, 1938) is a doctor, Dutch scholar, medical scientist, members of the Diet (the House of Peers [Japan]) in Japan.
Hiizu MIYAKE (November 1848 - March 16, 1938) is a doctor, Dutch scholar, medical scientist, members of the Diet (the House of Peers [Japan]) in Japan.
sen.cmt: ・生誕年が抜けていたので追加しました。
sen.e: Hiizu MIYAKE (November 1848 - March 16, 1938) is a doctor, Dutch scholar, medical scientist, members of the Diet (the House of Peers [Japan]) in Japan.

sen.j: 東京大学で最初の博士 (医学)、のち名誉教授。
sen.e: He is the first hakase (professor) (medical) in Tokyo University, and later he became a honorary professor.
He is the first Doctor of Medical Science in Tokyo University, and later he became a honorary professor.
sen.cmt: ・「医学博士」と解釈し、英語表現を修正しました。
sen.e: He is the first Doctor of Medical Science in Tokyo University, and later he became a honorary professor.

sen.j: 幼名は復一（またいち）。
sen.e: His childhood name is Mataichi.
His childhood name is Mataichi.
His childhood name is Mataichi.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 三宅家は、肥前国にて代々医業を行ってきた家系である。
sen.e: Miyake family has been practicing medicine in Hizen Province for generations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Miyake family has been practicing medicine in Hizen Province for generations.
Miyake family has been practicing medicine in Hizen Province for generations.

sen.j: 秀は、種痘所（現東京大学医学部の起源）の創設に携わった医師三宅艮斎（みやけ ごんさい）の長男として江戸本所で生まれる。
sen.e: Hiizu was born at Edo honjo as the eldest son of the doctor Gonsai MIYAKE who was engaged in establishing shutosho (vaccination institute) (the origin of current Tokyo University, the faculty of Medicine of Oita University)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Hiizu was born at Edo honjo as the eldest son of the doctor Gonsai MIYAKE who was engaged in establishing shutosho (vaccination institute) (the origin of current Tokyo University, the faculty of Medicine).
sen.cmt: ・原文に該当しない箇所（文尾）を削除しました。
sen.e: Hiizu was born at Edo honjo as the eldest son of the doctor Gonsai MIYAKE who was engaged in establishing shutosho (vaccination institute) (the origin of current Tokyo University, the faculty of Medicine).

sen.j: 安政4年（1858年）：川島元成のもとで蘭学を習い始める。
sen.e: 1858: he started to learn Western studies under Gonzai MIYAKE.
1858: he started to learn Western studies under Motonari KAWASHIMA.
sen.cmt: ・原文と異なる名前が入っていたので修正しました。・川島元成の読みが確認できませんでしたが、「かわしまもとなり」として表記しました。
sen.e: 1858: he started to learn Western studies under Motonari KAWASHIMA.

sen.j: 文久3年（1863年）：田辺太一の従者として遣欧使節に随行。
sen.e: 1863: he accompanied Shisetsu (Embassy to Europe) as a follower of Taichi TANABE.
1863: he accompanied Keno Shisetsu (Mission to Europe) as a follower of Taichi TANABE.
sen.cmt: ・「遣欧使節」は用語集に合わせて修正しました。
sen.e: 1863: he accompanied Keno Shisetsu (Mission to Europe) as a follower of Taichi TANABE.

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）：欧州より帰国後、横浜でヘボンに英学を学び、元アメリカ海軍医アレキサンダー・ウェッダー（Alexander M.Vedder）の助手となり医学を学ぶ。
sen.e: In 1864, after he came back from Europe, he learned English studies from Hepburn, he also became an assistant of Alexander M.Vedder, the former American navy doctor and learned medicine.
1864: after he came back from Europe, he learned English studies from Hepburn in Yokohama, and he became an assistant of Alexander M. Vedder, the former American navy doctor and learned medicine.
sen.cmt: ・年号の表記をほかの文章と統一させました。・「横浜」が抜けていました。
sen.e: 1864: after he came back from Europe, he learned English studies from Hepburn in Yokohama, and he became an assistant of Alexander M. Vedder, the former American navy doctor and learned medicine.

sen.j: 慶応3年（1867年）：加賀藩壮猶館にて英書翻訳や英学教授に従事。
sen.e: 1867: he was engaged in translation of English books and worked as a professor of English studies at the Kaga Domain.
1867: he was engaged in translation of English books and worked as a professor of English studies at Soyukan of the Kaga Domain.
sen.cmt: ・「壮猶館」が抜けていました。「そうゆうかん」と読むようです。http://narusenikki.web.infoseek.co.jp/text/kaisetu.html
sen.e: 1867: he was engaged in translation of English books and worked as a professor of English studies at Soyukan of the Kaga Domain.

sen.j: 明治3年（1870年）：大学へ出仕、中助教、大助教、文部少教授を歴任。
sen.e: 1870: he served at the university, and successively held posts of intermediate assistant professor, senior assistant professor, and 文部少 professor.
sen.cmt: 中助教、大助教、文部少教授→定訳不明ですが、それぞれ、→intermidiate assistant professor, senior assistant professor, 文部少 professorと訳出しました。
sen.e: 1870: he served at the university, and successively held posts of intermediate assistant professor, senior assistant professor, and 文部少 professor.
sen.cmt: ・「中助教、大助教、文部少教授」が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: 1870: he served at the university, and successively held posts of intermediate assistant professor, senior assistant professor, and 文部少 professor.

sen.j: 明治7年（1874年）：東京医学校長心得となる。
sen.e: 1874: he became an acting school master of Tokyo medicine school.
sen.cmt: 東京医学校長心得→定訳不明ですが→acting school master of Tokyo medicine school と訳出しました。
sen.e: 1874: he became an acting school master of Tokyo medicine school.
sen.cmt: ・「東京医学校長心得」が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: 1874: he became an acting school master of Tokyo medicine school.

sen.j: 明治9年（1876年）：渡米、万国医学会の副会長に選任。
sen.e: 1876: he went to the United states, and was selected to the vice-president of international medical convention.
sen.cmt: 万国医学会→定訳不明ですが→international medical conventionと訳出しました。
sen.e: 1876: he went to the United states, and was selected to the vice-president of international medical convention.
sen.cmt: ・「万国医学会」が確認できませんでした。
sen.e: 1876: he went to the United states, and was selected to the vice-president of international medical convention.

sen.j: 明治14年（1881年）：東京大学医学部長、その後、医科大学教授、医科大学長を歴任。
sen.e: 1881: the dean of the medical school of Tokyo university, and then successively held the posts of the professor of medical university, the head of medical university.
1881: the dean of the medical school of Tokyo university, and then successively held the posts of the professor of medical university and the head of medical university.
sen.cmt: ・並列されている肩書きの最後にandを追加しました。
sen.e: 1881: the dean of the medical school of Tokyo university, and then successively held the posts of the professor of medical university and the head of medical university.

sen.j: 明治21年（1888年）：東京大学初の医学博士に。
sen.e: 1888: he became the first Doctor of Tokyo University.
1888: he became the first Doctor of Medical Science of Tokyo University.
sen.cmt: ・「医学博士」は英辞郎で確認し修正しました。
sen.e: 1888: he became the first Doctor of Medical Science of Tokyo University.

sen.j: 明治24年（1891年）：貴族院議員。
sen.e: 1891: he became a member of the House of Peers.
1891: he became a member of the House of Peers.
1891: he became a member of the House of Peers.

sen.j: 明治36年（1903年）：東京大学初の名誉教授となる。
sen.e: 1903: he became the first honorary professor of Tokyo University.
1903: he became the first honorary professor of Tokyo University.
1903: he became the first honorary professor of Tokyo University.

sen.j: 昭和13年（1938年）：92歳にて永眠。
sen.e: 1938: he died at the age of 92.
1938: he died at the age of 92.
1938: he died at the age of 92.

sen.j: 著書
sen.e: Books
Books
Books

sen.j: 三宅秀編訳『病体剖観示要』島村利助、丸屋善七共同刊行、1879年
sen.e: Translated by Hiizu MIYAKE, "病体剖観示要," published jointly with Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYAMA in 1879
sen.cmt: 病体剖観示要→定訳不明ですが、原文のままとしています。定訳不明ですが、島村利助→Risuke SHIMAMURA、丸屋善七→Zenshichi MARUYAMAと訳出しています。
sen.e: Translated by Hiizu MIYAKE, "病体剖観示要," published jointly with Risuke SHIMAMURA and Zenshichi MARUYAMA in 1879
sen.cmt: ・『病体剖観示要』を確認できませんでした。
